goal.title: End poverty in all its forms everywhere

indicators.title: Percentage of homeless people assisted (access to a public residential resource, temporary resource or with sustained support)
Number of homeless Barcelona residents
Rate of severe material and social deprivation
People at risk of income poverty after social transfers
The anual average number of days wait between the date of the visit to the Social Services Centre and the date when the visit was scheduled
Population in households that have experienced delays in paying bills for water, electricity, gas, etc., in the last 12 months
Number of care units provided by the Center for Emergencies and Social Emergencies (CUESB) and number of people cared for in a social emergency
The number of community support networks for people in vulnerable situations
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to the goal of reducing poverty

goal.title: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

indicators.title: Prevalence rate for food deprivation (Population that cannot afford a meal containing animal protein once every two days or the nutritional equivalent in vegetable protein)
Prevalence rate for obesity
Number of urban gardens
Proportion of municipal market stalls classified as ‘green stallholders’
Agroecological agricultural land over the total agricultural area used
Annual volume of local produce sold at the Mercabarna's Central Fruit and Vegetable Market
Consumption of meat in the adult population (Kg/year)
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to the objective of improving nutrition and agricultural production

goal.title: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

indicators.title: Barcelona’s maternal mortality rate per 1,000 births
Premature mortality rate for children under the age of five
Mortality rate for newborn children (babies less than 28 days old), for every 1,000 children born alive
Accumulated incidence for COVID-19 (per 100,000 inhabitants)
HIV incidence rate (per 100,000 inhabitants)
Tuberculosis incidence rate (per 100,000 inhabitants)
Gonorrhoea incidence rate (per 100,000 inhabitants)
Premature mortality rate
Prevalence of poor mental health or risk of psychological suffering (above three points on the General Health Questionnaire, GHQ-12)
Percentage of adult population doing sport
Prevalence of harmful alcohol consumption among adults
Prevalence of harmful cannabis consumption among adults
Prevalence of harmful alcohol consumption among people aged 15 to 24
Prevalence of harmful cannabis consumption among adolescents
Annual number of people killed in traffic collisions
Annual number of people seriously injured in traffic collisions
Pregnancy rate in women aged between 15 and 19
The differential in the pregnancy rate for women aged 15 to 19 between the district with the highest rate and the district with the lowest rate

Composite indicator of the percentage of the population older than 15 years old who, in spite of needing it, do not have access to the following healthcare treatments due to economic reasons: dental care, mental health care and/or medication with medical prescription
Annual number of deaths attributed to excessive atmospheric pollution (above the WHO threshold* for both NO2 and PM2.5)
Percentage of people over the age of 15 who smoke every day compared to the total population in this age group
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to the objective of improving public health and health systems
Health worker density and distribution
Approval of the Metropolitan Emergency Plan for Pandemic Situations

goal.title: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all

indicators.title: Achievement rate for the five basic skill tests undertaken in the 4th year of compulsory secondary education
ESO graduation rate broken down by district, the percentage difference between the best and worst performing districts for graduation rate
School attendance rate for one-year-old children
School attendance rate for two-year-old children
Differential in the school attendance rate for two-year-old children between the districts
Proportion of people between the ages of 30 and 34 who have a higher-education qualification (university or advanced vocational qualification)
Proportion of people between the ages of 20 and 24 who have at least a higher secondary school (Batxillerat) or Intermediate Vocational qualification
Early leavers from education and training
School segregation level based on the distribution of foreign students and students with Special Educational Needs
The proportion of children and adolescents who live in households with the conditions needed to make good use of digital and online learning
Proportion of people over the age of 17 who consider that they can speak a) Catalan, b) Spanish, c) English

Proportion of education centres that are members of the More Sustainable Schools network (including, nursery, infant, primary, compulsory-secondary (ESO), vocational training, special, higher-secondary and adult schools)
Proportion of children who state they know their rights, as established in the Children’s Rights Convention, at the end of their primary education (6th year)
The number of Education for Global Justice projects that promote critical education and foster peace, human rights, sustainability and gender equality
Children attended at the Children’s development and early-attention centres (CDIAP) in Barcelona
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to the objective of improving education

goal.title: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

indicators.title: Gender Equality Index 0-100
The percentage of women over the age of 16 who have suffered a situation of gender violence (excluding comments, sexual gestures and exhibitionism) within the last year
The number of women murdered, victims of gender violence
Complaints filed for gender-based violence and domestic violence
Incidents reported for gender-based violence and domestic violence
Family units assisted by the Municipal Unit Against Human Trafficking (UTEH), victims of sexual exploitation and human trafficking for reasons of sexual exploitation
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme allocated to combating gender violence in countries receiving ODA
Specialist personnel in member cities involved in specialist exchange programmes concerning the fight against gender violence
The percentage of people who look after a dependent person without any support
Gender gap in care work
Gender gap in housework
Cover of dependency benefits
The number of companies and organisations that are members of the NUST (New Social Uses of Time) network
Proportion of women in the Full Council of Barcelona City Council
Proportion of women in Barcelona City Council government and manager’s office posts
Proportion of public cultural facilities (municipal or associated) run by women
Proportion of women on the board of directors and in management positions in companies with more than 50 employees
Proportion of women aged 15–49 years who make their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use and reproductive health care
Number of countries with laws and regulations that guarantee full and equal access to women and men aged 15 years and older to sexual and reproductive health care, information and education

(a) Proportion of total agricultural population with ownership or secure rights over agricultural land, by sex; and (b) share of women among owners or rights-bearers of agricultural land, by type of tenure
Proportion of countries where the legal framework (including customary law) guarantees women’s equal rights to land ownership and/or control

Index for digital empowerment in women (a multi-dimensional index that includes access to devices, connection, knowledge, the type of tools used, the reason for use, e.g. the percentage of women users of Decidim)
Degree of implementation of the successive plans for gender justice

goal.title: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all

indicators.title: Index of the economic effort needed to pay the water bill
Number of days in each hydrological drought situation scenario
Number of illegal settlements in Barcelona
Ratio of sewer rehabilitation
Estimated volume of filtered water underground
Average age of the sewer network
Economic losses due to groundwater pollution
Sewer network rehabilitation
Domestic water consumption measured in litres per inhabitant per day
Urban water consumption measured in litres per inhabitant per day
Use of grey water
Use of rainwater on roofs
Use of regenerated water in the Marina neighbourhood (in m3)
Participation as partners in research projects devoted to the integrated management of water resources
Support and collaboration in research projects devoted to the integrated management of water resources
Increase the operational surface area of sustainable urban drainage systems
Network water consumed by municipal services (in m3)
Change in the extent of water-related ecosystems over time
Forecast of percentage of non-compliance time of the microbiological quality of the water on the beaches of Barcelona during the bathing season
Annual volume of groundwater extracted for municipal use (m3)
Percentage of analytics with values> 2000µS / cm of conductivity
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated improving water supplies and sanitation
Specialist personnel in member cities involved in specialist exchange programmes concerning water-cycle management
Pending definition

goal.title: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all

indicators.title: Proportion of people in households who cannot maintain their homes at an adequate temperature
TIEPI Duration of power cut equivalent to the installed capacity at medium voltage in urban areas in the Province of Barcelona
Proportion of the electricity consumed in Barcelona that comes from renewable sources
Proportion of energy consumed in Barcelona that has been locally generated using renewable resources
Number of energy rating A and B buildings
Proportion of municipal buildings that are subjected to energy renovation every year
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to energy supply and generation
Installed renewable energy-generating capacity in developing countries (in watts per capita)

goal.title: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all

indicators.title: Real annual per-capita GDP growth rate
Percentage of municipal expenditure on the green and circular economy sector, over total budget expenditure
Index value of GDP growth per employed person
Diversification index for the productive sectors
Total Entrepreneurial Activity rate over the total 18-64 population
GDP of the social economy over total GDP
Greenhouse gas emissions generated by the commerce sector
Kg of industrial waste generated per €1,000 of GVA in industry
Number of people as unemployed
Proportion of workers at risk of poverty
Gender pay gap

Differential between youth unemployment rate and average unemployment rate
Proportion of young people who are neither employed, studying nor receiving training
Proportion and number of children aged 5–17 years engaged in child labour, by sex and age
Number of serious injuries and deaths in the workplace per 100,000 inhabitants
Number of illnesses associated with salaried work per 100,000 inhabitants
Proportion of workers with temporary contracts over total number of workers
Gender gap in the proportion of workers with temporary contracts over total number of workers
Number of tourism establishments and services with the Barcelona Commitment label
Average expenditure per tourist per day, on accommodation (night) and for their total stay
Number of tourist accommodation places with respect to the residential population

goal.title: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation

indicators.title: Degree of achievement of the strategic projects for the economic transformation of Barcelona
Volume of CO2 emissions generated by the industrial sector
Weighting of industry in the GAV generated in the Barcelona Metropolitan Area
Gross added value at factor cost of SMEs in Barcelona
Financial strength index of SMEs in Barcelona
Composite indicator on the use of Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) by SMEs in Barcelona
Indicators for the process and results relating to Barcelona’s digital transformation plan
Barcelona’s position in the Innovation Cities Index (European ranking)
Barcelona’s position in scientific production (European and world ranking)
Technological intensity, measured as the total number of patents per million inhabitants
Total official international support (official development assistance plus other official flows) to infrastructure
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to improving industry, innovation and/or infrastructure
Specialist personnel in member cities involved in specialist exchange programmes concerning infrastructure development
Proportion of people over the age of 18 that have internet access
Proportion of people over the age of 18 who have a computer (laptop or desktop) at home

goal.title: Reduce inequality within and among countries

indicators.title: Ratio 80/20: the relative gap between the 20% of the population with the highest income and the 20% with the lowest income
Gap between the neighbourhoods with the highest average and lowest average incomes (neighbourhoods that account for approximately 5% of the population in both cases)
Proportion for the gap between average per-capita annual income for Barcelona city and the Barcelona Metropolitan Area
AROPE rate (proportion of the population at risk of poverty and/or exclusion)
Perception of loneliness
Perception of loneliness in young people

Differential in the use of cultural services and activities, calculated as a percentage, between the average for the population as a whole and the average for the population with a low socio-economic level
Number of people who have access to personal-autonomy and independent-life programmes
Annual number of complaints about situations of discrimination compiled by the Board of Organisations Assisting Victims of Discrimination
Proportion of young people who have experienced some kind of discrimination in the last 12 months due to disability, sexual orientation, origin or gender
City Council expenditure per inhabitant on social services and social promotion, calculated based on functional unit 23 of the liquidated municipal budget
Availability of a strategy for social inclusion and reducing social inequalities
The differential between the AROPE rate (risk of poverty and social exclusion) for foreign nationals compared to Spanish nationals
Differential of employed people aged between 20 and 64, between Spanish nationals and foreign nationals
Percentage of workers forming part of municipal personnel who were born abroad
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to promoting equality and the fight against racism and discrimination

goal.title: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable

indicators.title: Proportion of people in households that allocate more than 40% of their resources to housing expenditure
Proportion of protected rental housing in relation to the to the total housing stock of main residencies
Annual number of evictions carried out in Barcelon
Total modal distribution (proportion of journey stages made by mean of transportation)
Evaluation of the management of the various types of public transport by the people who use them: Metro, tram, bus and Bicing
Degree of bus fleet electrification
Journeys/year in the door-to-door service for people with disabilities
The most frequently used means of transport to go to the main activities
Km of green corridors in Barcelona’s urban area
Number of schools benefiting from urban-planning actions to create protected school environments
Number of people/total visitors that have entered public museums and exhibition centres either at a discount price or free of charge
Number of collection items accessible online annually
Quantification of material damage caused by water related disasters (millions of euros)
Quantification of material damage caused by severe climate episodes
Investment in prevention and protection measures to deal with severe climate episodes
Average concentration of NO2 , PM10 and PM2,5 in μg/m3

Specialist personnel in member cities involved in specialist exchange programmes concerning urban planning and housing

goal.title: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns

indicators.title: Proportion of energy consumption of renewable origin
Proportion of municipal waste that is recovered
Proportion of sanitation operations in municipal buildings with water-saving mechanisms
Tonnes of food used by the Barcelona food bank that come from food wastage
Tonnes of food waste at Mercabarna
Indicator for the presence of plastic waste in Barcelona’s environment (to be determined)
Indicator for the policy to combat the impact of plastic and microplastics on Barcelona’s environment (to be determined)
Kg/inhabitant/day of solid urban waste collected
Percentage of collected solid urban waste that is then recycled
Number of organisations with environmental certificates

Barcelona City Council’s score on the composite index for sustainable public procurement produced by the One Planet Network Sustainable Public Procurement Programme (created from a series of indicators for the process and results of public procurement policies)
Number of organisations that have joined the More Sustainable Barcelona network
Resources from the municipal Global Justice programme allocated to the promotion of more sustainable consumption and production models
Implementation of standard accounting tools to monitor the economic and environmental aspects of tourism sustainability

goal.title: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts

indicators.title: Proportion of the population that have a climate refuge less than 10 minuts walk from their home
Surface of water sheets of ornamental fountains
Number of multifunctional fountains in schools, open school yards
Reduction in GHG emissions compared to 1992
The existence of an operational Climate Emergency Committee at a city level
Number of districts with environmental education facilities

Percentage of the city’s cultural facilities (municipal and associated) that allocate part of their budget to raising awareness about the environment or on actions to improve the sustainability of their facilities
Amounts provided and mobilized in United States dollars per year in relation to the continued existing collective mobilization goal of the $100 billion commitment through to 2025
Resources of the municipal Global Justice programme, allocated to the prevention and mitigation of the effects of climate change

goal.title: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development

indicators.title: Volume of solid waste from the unitary sewer system, prevented from reaching the sea in rainy weather episodes (measured in m3 of waste/days with substantial rainfall per year)
Percentage of overflow days (Unit System Downloads - DSU *) in rainy weather on the beaches of Barcelona in relation to significant rainy days  (> = 1mm)
Water-quality indicator for Barcelona’s beaches
Number of marine species identified on the coast of Barcelona
Nautical Science Training and Technological Node project
Barcelona Sea of Science project
Number of fishing boats and artisan-fishing boats (smaller boats and gear) active in Barcelona
Economic value of catches made by the Port of Barcelona fishing fleet

goal.title: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss

indicators.title: Number of biodiversity nodes and nature reserves created since 2015
Proportion of important sites for terrestrial and freshwater biodiversity that are covered by protected areas, by ecosystem type

Mountain Green Cover Index
Biodiversity index for native birds
Percentage of Barcelona Zoo’s research and conservation projects or actions dedicated to native species of fauna (including mixed projects)

Indicator of the fight against the trafficking of protected plant and animal species (to be determined)
Indicator of the fight against the proliferation of invasive plant and animal species (to be determined)
Proportion of countries adopting relevant national legislation and adequately resourcing the prevention or control of invasive alien species
The proportion of strategies and plans regarding the economic and urban-planning development of Barcelona, which adequately include the vision and goals of SDG 15
Achievement indicators for the various transformation phases leading to the new model for Barcelona Zoo
Degree of development of the Biodiversity Research Institute project
(a) Official development assistance on conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity; and (b) revenue generated and finance mobilized from biodiversity-relevant economic instruments

goal.title: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels

indicators.title: Number of violent deaths (murder and manslaughter) known by the city’s police forces

Total value of inward and outward illicit financial flows (in current United States dollars)

indicators.title: Total government revenue as a proportion of GDP, by source
